nodes.label: Indiana State Prison South
nodes.notes: Opened 1822, 6 years after Indiana statehood; AKA Jeffersonville prison; all female prisoners out by 1877

nodes.label: Clarksville, Indiana
nodes.notes: Right outside of Jeffersonville--seems to be used interchangably as the location of Indiana State Prison South

nodes.label: Mary A. Johnson
nodes.notes: first matron of ISPS, specifically matron of female prisoners

nodes.label: Eva Green
nodes.notes: testified in 1869 trial against Jo Vanoy who she said sexually abused her and other inmates.

nodes.label: Colonel Lawrence S. Shuler
nodes.notes: Warden of ISPS; former military commander in Civil War; subject of 1871 investigation about treatment of female prisoners; more positive opinion from male prisoners; Auditor of Hendricks County

nodes.label: Ackworth, England
nodes.notes: Location of Quaker Friends boarding school (unknown what its name is)

nodes.label: Elizabeth Comstock
nodes.notes: Quaker minister, abolitionist, and social reformer

nodes.label: Home Mission Association of Women of the Yearly Meeting
nodes.notes: AKA HMAW; more of a group than institution

nodes.label: Indianapolis Home for Friendless Women
nodes.notes: AKA IHFW; started 1867; outside Indianapolis city limits on N. Tennessee St.

nodes.label: Belle Ward
nodes.notes: lived 1840-1873; under alias Smith when she arrived at HFFW

nodes.label: Dr. Bigelow
nodes.notes: Indianapolis undertaker who provided death certificate for Belle Ward

nodes.label: Charles Todd
nodes.notes: Advisory committee member to Belle Ward trial

nodes.label: Thomas H. Sharpe
nodes.notes: Advisory committee member to Belle Ward trial

nodes.label: Indiana Reformatory Institution for Women and Girls
nodes.notes: First public prison for women in the US; aka Indiana Girls' Industrial School and Women's Prison

nodes.notes: justice of the Indiana Supreme Court (1853-54)

nodes.notes: elite man of Indianapolis on IRIWG board of managers

nodes.notes: elite man of Indianapolis on IRIWG board of managers
